1.text: Listen to this word which I take up for a lamentation over you, O house of Israel.

2.text: “The virgin of Israel has fallen; She shall rise no more. She is cast down on her land; there is no one to raise her up.”

3.text: For thus says the Lord Yahweh: “The city that went forth a thousand shall have a hundred left, and that which went forth one hundred shall have ten left to the house of Israel.”

4.text: For thus says Yahweh to the house of Israel: “Seek me, and you will live;

5.text: but don’t seek Bethel, nor enter into Gilgal, and don’t pass to Beersheba: for Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, and Bethel shall come to nothing.

6.text: Seek Yahweh, and you will live; lest he break out like fire in the house of Joseph, and it devour, and there be no one to quench it in Bethel.

7.text: You who turn justice to wormwood, and cast down righteousness to the earth:

8.text: seek him who made the Pleiades and Orion, and turns the shadow of death into the morning, and makes the day dark with night; who calls for the waters of the sea, and pours them out on the surface of the earth, Yahweh is his name,

9.text: who brings sudden destruction on the strong, so that destruction comes on the fortress.

10.text: They hate him who reproves in the gate, and they abhor him who speaks blamelessly.

11.text: Forasmuch therefore as you trample on the poor, and take taxes from him of wheat: You have built houses of cut stone, but you will not dwell in them. You have planted pleasant vineyards, but you shall not drink their wine.

12.text: For I know how many your offenses, and how great are your sins—you who afflict the just, who take a bribe, and who turn aside the needy in the courts.

13.text: Therefore a prudent person keeps silent in such a time, for it is an evil time.

14.text: Seek good, and not evil, that you may live; and so Yahweh, the God of Armies, will be with you, as you say.

15.text: Hate evil, love good, and establish justice in the courts. It may be that Yahweh, the God of Armies, will be gracious to the remnant of Joseph.”

16.text: Therefore thus says Yahweh, the God of Armies, the Lord: “Wailing will be in all the broad ways; and they will say in all the streets, ‘Alas! Alas!’ and they will call the farmer to mourning, and those who are skillful in lamentation to wailing.

17.text: In all vineyards there will be wailing; for I will pass through the midst of you,” says Yahweh.

18.text: “Woe to you who desire the day of Yahweh! Why do you long for the day of Yahweh? It is darkness, and not light.

19.text: As if a man fled from a lion, and a bear met him; Or he went into the house and leaned his hand on the wall, and a snake bit him.

20.text: Won’t the day of Yahweh be darkness, and not light? Even very dark, and no brightness in it?

21.text: I hate, I despise your feasts, and I can’t stand your solemn assemblies.

22.text: Yes, though you offer me your burnt offerings and meal offerings, I will not accept them; neither will I regard the peace offerings of your fat animals.

23.text: Take away from me the noise of your songs! I will not listen to the music of your harps.

24.text: But let justice roll on like rivers, and righteousness like a mighty stream.

25.text: “Did you bring to me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness forty years, house of Israel?

26.text: You also carried the tent of your king and the shrine of your images, the star of your god, which you made for yourselves.

27.text: Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus,” says Yahweh, whose name is the God of Armies.
